bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ROYCE of California:H.R. 1456.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Under Article I, Section 8, Clause 3 of the U.S.Constitution to regulate commerce.[Page H2020]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Power and Oceans.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

bill.title: Shark Fin Sales Elimination Act of 2017

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Shark Fin Sales Elimination Act of 2017

This bill makes it illegal to possess, buy, or sell shark fins or any product containing shark fins.A person may possess a shark fin that was lawfully taken consistent with a license or permit under certain circumstances.

Penalties areimposedfor violations under the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
